body: @minrk @Carreau @ellisonbg please review :)
Definitely looks like an improvement, thanks for working on it. I'll get to review this weekend.
And by weekend, I apparently mean Tuesday. For cereal, this time.

> For cereal, this time.

Closest icon to cereal I could find is stew :stew:.  Hopefully 'for stew' works too ;)

Can you test this with very long output (e.g. `np.array?`)? It looks like it's just positioned at the bottom, which doesn't work if the content is taller than the screen. You may need to do some max-height, scrolling stuff.

@minrk I tested, the last commit fixes the problem.  Although one caveat, in order to close or resize the pager, it must be scrolled to the top because that's where the sizing handle and close buttons are.  What do you think of this behavior?  My gut tells me it's weird.  I'll probably need another div to fix it properly.

overflow is already auto, so `max-height: 50%` does seem to do it. The resize handle is now a tiny 1-2px, can you fix that?

It looks like `div#notebook` is still getting its height set when the pager is shown, can you find where that's happening?

> I'll probably need another div to fix it properly.

`position: fixed` should be all you need on those.

> position: fixed should be all you need on those.

That trick doesn't seem to work for the resize handle that jquery-ui manages because it's trying to manage the position of the resize handle itself.  It's okay though, the extra div solution doesn't look like too much work.
@minrk I fixed all the stuff we were talking about, including the notebook height problem.
Is it possible to make the pager handle more than one pixel in height?

> Is it possible to make the pager handle more than one pixel in height?

Yeah, actually the clickable region is 7px.  Are you talking about the visual representation of the handle?  Or are you saying the clickable region is not 7px for you?

> Yeah, actually the clickable region is 7px. Are you talking about the visual representation of the handle? Or are you saying the clickable region is not 7px for you?

Both. There is no visual handle, and the only clickable region is the 1-2px pager border.

Agreed with min. The culprit is in jquery that adds a `top:5px` to the handle, but that the pager itself is overflow-hidden. leadingto 7-5 = 2 pixel actually usable area. adding a padding-bottom of 5px, or top:0 to `#pager > ui resizable-handle` seem to do the trick

Side-note, this apparently does not fix the 'repaint' problem. the all page is repainted on each scroll.
The pager seem that it needs to be moved outside of the `#site` div.
Even though the repaint issues does not go away.weird.

Hmm, let's see what it would take to solve the repaint issue...

On Thu, Nov 27, 2014 at 12:47 AM, Matthias Bussonnier <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Even though the repaint issues does not go away.weird.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/7011#issuecomment-64760845.

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
@ellisonbg on Twitter and GitHub
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com
Hum, I'll recheck. Any way if its a step toward getting rid of a do-resize I'm +1.
rebased
MIss ability to reopen the pager when close by clicking a button or smth. ( without ?? on object of course)

In this case I can't scroll up more. 

![capture d ecran 2014-12-04 a 17 16 05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/5301459/5024a4ba-7bd9-11e4-85d2-d59f138a1996.png)

I do see the redraw but only on open pager, which is a step forward. 

![capture d ecran 2014-12-04 a 17 19 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/5301531/dabe7d12-7bd9-11e4-9086-600c3bc25775.png)
![capture d ecran 2014-12-04 a 17 20 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/5301543/ebe51650-7bd9-11e4-8d1f-4c4930d8c329.png)
I think the pager delimitation is hard to see, but I guess this will be better once we get the document border and background @ellisonbg like.

I agree that the document border will help but  I also think we need to
improve the pager delimitation. This can be merged without that though.

notifications@github.com> wrote:

> better once we get the document border and background @ellisonbg

@Carreau that is so strange, do the same thing as you, I don't see the page redrawn like in your screenshot.. :frowning: Maybe it's an extension you have installed?  Or some custom css?

> This can be merged without that though.

Agreed we can refine the design later, but the pager prevent to see what's behind and I can't scroll is blocker IMHO.

Merging this PR make the notebook unusable for me, as I can't read nor click the last 2 to 5 cells of my notebook/

> @Carreau that is so strange, do the same thing as you, I don't see the page redrawn like in your screenshot..  Maybe it's an extension you have installed? Or some custom css?

I don't think so but I can check.

No, no custom.js nor css. 

And correction the pager can hide up to 8 cells on my screen.
